text: NF-kappaB activation is a critical regulator of human granulocyte apoptosis in vitro .
During beneficial inflammation , potentially tissue - damaging granulocytes undergo apoptosis before being cleared by phagocytes in a non-phlogistic manner .

Here we show that the rate of constitutive apoptosis in human neutrophils and eosinophils is greatly accelerated in both a rapid and concentration - dependent manner by the fungal metabolite gliotoxin , but not by its inactive analog methylthiogliotoxin .

This induction of apoptosis was abolished by the caspase inhibitor zVAD-fmk , correlated with the inhibition of nuclear factor-kappa B ( NF-kappaB ) , and was mimicked by a cell permeable inhibitory peptide of NF-kappaB , SN-50 ; other NF-kappaB inhibitors , curcumin and pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ; and the proteasome inhibitor , MG-132 .

Gliotoxin also augmented dramatically the early ( 2-6 h ) pro-apoptotic effects of <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in neutrophils and unmasked the ability of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to induce eosinophil apoptosis .

In neutrophils , <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> caused a gliotoxin - inhibitable activation of an inducible form of NF-kappaB , a response that may underlie the ability of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to delay apoptosis at later times ( 12-24 h ) and limit its early killing effect .

text: Furthermore , cycloheximide displayed a similar capacity to enhance <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced neutrophil apoptosis even at time points when cycloheximide alone had no pro-apoptotic effect , suggesting that NF-kappaB may regulate the production of protein ( s ) which protect neutrophils from the cytotoxic effects of <extra_id_0> TNF-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

These data shed light on the biochemical and molecular mechanisms regulating human granulocyte apoptosis and , in particular , indicate that the transcription factor NF-kappaB plays a crucial role in regulating the physiological cell death pathway in granulocytes .
